Alarms for Indoor units.detail: Momentary Power interruption or Low voltage detected

Alarms for Indoor units.detail: Activation of protection control for excessively high pressure
Alarms for Indoor units.main_factors: Stop after P12 retry due to discharge pressure Pd ≥ 2.78 MPa continued for 10 seconds
Stop after P06 retry due to Ps ≤ 0.15 MPa continued for 90 seconds
Immediate stop with Ps ≤ 0.1 MPa
Stop after P11 retry due to pressure ratio ε < 1.8 continued for 3 minutes
Td ≥ 120 ºC continued for 10 minutes, Td ≥ 140 ºC continued for 5 seconds

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Activation of protection device (high pressure cut)
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Activation of PSH, locked motor, abnormal operation in the power supply phase

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Abnormal transmission between outdoor and indoor units
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Incorrect wiring. Loose terminals, Failure of PCB. Tripping of fuse. Power supply OFF

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Abnormal transmission between inverter PCB and RASC unit PCB
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Transmission failure between inverter PCBs. (Loose Connector, Wire Breaking, Blowout of Fuse)

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Reception of abnormal operation code for detection of power source phase
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Power source with abnormal wave pattern. Main power supply phase is reversely connected or one phase is not connected

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Excessively low voltage or excessively high voltage for the inverter
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Voltage drop in power supply. Incorrect wiring or insufficient capacity of power supply wiring

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Decrease in discharge gas superheat
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Excessive Refrigerant Charge, Failure of Thermistor, Incorrect Wiring, Incorrect Piping Connection, Expansion Valve Locking at Opened Position (Disconnected Connector)

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Excessively high discharge gas temperature at the top of compressor
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Insufficient refrigerant charge, refrigerant leakage. Expansion valve closed or clogged

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Activation of the protection device for the indoor fan motor
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Failure of fan motor

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Thermistor for discharge gas temperature (THM9)
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Incorrect wiring, disconnected wiring, broken cable, short circuit

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Incorrect capacity setting or combined capacity between outdoor and indoor units
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Incorrect Capacity Code Setting, Excessive or Insufficient Indoor Unit Total Capacity Code

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Incorrect indoor unit number setting
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Duplication of indoor unit number, number of indoor units over specifications

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Incorrect of Indoor Unit Combination
Abnormality of picking up circuit for protection (Outdoor unit)
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Failure of indoor unit PCB, incorrect wiring, connection to PCB in indoor unit

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Activation of the safety device from excessively high discharge pressure
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Overload (obstruction of HEX, short circuit) mixture of inert gas, Excessive Refrigerant

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Activation of the safety device from excessively low suction pressure (protection from vacuum operation)
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Shortage or leakage of refrigerant, piping clogging, expansion valve close-locked, fan motor locked

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Activation of overcurrent protection
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Overload, overcurrent. Failure of Inverter PCB, heat exchanger clogged, locked compressor. EVI/EVO failure

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Abnormal operation of the current sensor
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Incorrect wiring of current sensor. Failure of control PCB or Inverter PCB

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Inverter fin temperature increase
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Inverter module (IPM, DIP-IPM) and Inverter PCB abnormality. Failure of compressor, clogging of heat exchanger

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Abnormality of inverter fin temperature
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Heat Exchanger Clogging. Fan Motor Failure

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Abnormality of inverter module
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Failure of DIP-IPM, IPM or Inverter PCB

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Activating the protection of the fan motor
Activation of over current protection
Abnormality in current detection circuit
Compressor protection
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Compressor failure. This alarm code appears when the following alarms 02, 07, 08, 45, 47 occur three times within 6 hours

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Incorrect setting of unit model
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: No setting of unit capacity or incorrect setting of unit capacity

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Incorrect setting address or refrigerant cycle
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: Over 64 indoor units setting by number or indoor unit address

Alarms for Outdoor units.detail: Incorrect setting of indoor unit number for H-LINK type
Alarms for Outdoor units.main_factors: The number of indoor units connected to the H-LINK II of one system is 17 or higher

Alarms for LCD.detail: Slave PC-ARFH1E stops answering to Master PC-ARFH1E
Alarms for LCD.main_factors: Loose, disconnected, broken or short-circuited connector

Alarms for LCD.detail: Indoor unit stops answering to Master PC-ARFH1E
Alarms for LCD.main_factors: Loose, disconnected, broken or short-circuited connector
